item.title: Itan add a quote by Susan Elizabeth Phillips
Itan add a quote by Susan Elizabeth Phillips
item.description: "I don't love you anymore", she whispered. "I don't love you at all." His throat closed. "It's all right, sweetheart. I love you enough for both of us." -- Susan Elizabeth Phillips

item.title: Itan add a quote by Susan Elizabeth Phillips
item.description: "Gracie: You have an unusual house. Have you lived here long? Bobby Tom: A couple of years. I don't much like it myself, but the architect is real proud of it. She calls it urban Stone Age with a Japanese Tahitian influence. I sort of just call it ugly." -- Susan Elizabeth Phillips

item.title: Itan add a quote by Susan Elizabeth Phillips
item.description:
"His mother?" Gracie couldn't believe it. Suzy Denton looked much too young to be his mother. And much too respectable. "But you're not a-" She cut herself off in mid-sentence as she realized what she'd almost let slip.
Suzy's wedding ring clicked against the steering wheel as she gave it a hard smack. "I'm going to kill him! He's been telling that hooker story again, hasn't he?" -- Susan Elizabeth Phillips

item.title: Itan add a quote by Susan Elizabeth Phillips
item.description: "He sounds like Jesus. Except rich and sexy.” “Watch it, Meg. In this town joking about Jesus could get you shot. You’ve never seen so many of the faithful who’re armed." -- Susan Elizabeth Phillips
